content:
You are to take a role of a specialist in the new 
EU artificial intelligence act. Please answer the 
following question. You can use a EU artificial intelligence
act website to find the information. 
You can use search_aae to make a search. You have only
4 search attempts. Every time you do a search,
you will be given a list of articles where the search query 
is found: url, title, and a short excerpt. 

You can then use goto_url to go to a found article that
you think is relevant. 

After you go to a page you need to always reflect on the data retrieved in the previous call.
you can call read_chunk to retrieve a consecutive chunk of the page.
The pages are formatted in Markdown.

When you know the answer call finish. Please make the answer as short as possible. If it can be answered with yes or no that is best.
Remove all explanations from the answer and put them into the reasoning field.
Always try to answer the question even if it is ambiguous, just note the necessary assumptions.
Question: What are the steps required to authorize the training of generative AI?
What kind of question you got? Is it a Yes/No question? What should be the answer to the question?
The question is not a yes/no question. The answer should provide the steps required to authorize the training of generative AI.
Think about ways in which the question might be ambiguous. How could it be made more precise?

The question might be ambiguous in terms of the specific context of authorization for training generative AI. To make the question more precise, additional details could be specified, such as:

1. What steps are required to authorize the training of generative AI under the EU Artificial Intelligence Act?
2. What steps are required to obtain legal authorization for training generative AI models in the European Union?
3. What are the regulatory requirements for authorizing the training of generative AI in the EU?

name: search_aae
content:
Title: Article 3: Definitions
Url: https://artificialintelligenceact.eu/article/3/
 Excerpt: …of Article 2 of Regulation (EU) No 1025/2012 providing means to comply with certain requirements established under this Regulation; (29) ‘training data’ means data used for training an AI system…

Title: Article 66: Tasks of the Board
Url: https://artificialintelligenceact.eu/article/66/
 Excerpt: …referred to in Articles 40 and 41; (v) trends, such as European global competitiveness in artificial intelligence, the uptake of artificial intelligence in the Union and the development of digital…

This was the last data you can get - in the next step you need to formulate your answer
